644516.self_intro:
I work for myself as a commercial photographer and I love it!
I have an office at home so sometimes i'm at home during the day working, so can greet you when you arrive, whilst other times I'm out working on location, if this is the case I will leave a key out for you and communicate this with you via the Air BnB message service.
Harry (my dog) and I go walking every morning. She will greet you very enthusiastically when you arrive at the house and be ready for a scratch on her tummy from you to say hello.
It's great to meeting and hosting new people from all over the world and have a chat over a coffee or a wine and share my local knowledge with you, and hear about your travelling experiences, but I also respect your privacy, and my work keeps me pretty busy too!
I love being an Air BnB host and have made some great friends from the guests who have stayed with me from all over the world.
I am aware a lot of people are looking for longer term accommodation, however, short term stays suits me, and I'm not looking for any guests to stay longer than 1 month.
I look forward to meeting you.
644516.name: Mel

45902462.self_intro:
Hi all,
I'm Katie, a graphic designer based in Sydney. I'm an on-off Airbnb host who just love to use Airbnb for travel accommodation like you do. My Airbnb experience ( both host and guest) are incredibly amazing and memorable, I met so many amazing guests/hosts who came from all around the world and there have been always different stories to take away afterward. Regardless of a few bad reviews  that upset me, those good hosting experiences truly motivate me. Honestly, I'm not making a living on this, Airbnb apparently a thing set me free from paying the bills while I'm travelling and  I would never stop feeling grateful for this mutual share of benefit. Travelling is a part of learning process and lifestyle, I hope my Airbnb place could be a part of your beautiful journey as well. 
Please notice that most of the time you will checkin/out by yourself as I could be away by that time. I expect guest will be more aware of your trip/ time management, so bit careful read/research about your Airbnb place will save both our time and effort. 

Ps: Tks for reading anyway, usually people roll past this part:-)
45902462.name: Kate

Hi there, Born in NZ to a long line of danish vikings, I moved to Australia when I was 17 and then to London when I was 20...

Ever since then I've been addicted to travelling and bounced around the world non stop for about 4 years during which time I backpacked to over 90 countries, became a Dive Instructor in Thailand and eventually decided to commute between London and Sydney for the summers on both sides of the earth. I trade forex in my spare time, Background in Sales and Marketing, Building Construction and Renovations, IT Project Management and studied Clinical Nutrition, I'm now 32
6875353.name: Nathan

14813306.self_intro:
Hi,
My name is Tania, I am an artist and and have been creating, adding to and evolving my spacious, colourful, bohemian loft style home for the past few decades. I share this much loved space with my beautiful daughter and my 2 cats.
Aside from painting and exhibiting within Australia I am very fortunate to have an annual 3 month painting residency in Tahiti.
I usually go for the months of July, August and September to paint, teach, exhibit, gather inspiration and enjoy that beautiful part of the world. 
Since 2015 I have been sharing my eclectic and creative world on airbnb which includes my spacious bohemian home my 2 gorgeous cats Fellini and Poerava, but we call her 'Popo', a truly eclectic accumulation of art, artefacts and collectables and the wonderful village  of Rozelle where I spend the other part of my life when not in Tahiti.

As I will be away I would prefer guests who are seeking a longer term stay, 2-3 months would be ideal and I am offering a great discount as incentive.
My dear friend Kathrin, who lives down the road will be acting as land lady, should you need any assistance she is just a phone call away.
14813306.name: Tania

1820335.self_intro:
Hello, my name is Sherry, and I am originally from the United States. My partner and I have taken over from the lovely Dave and Lisa to run this apartment. We look forward to giving you the same experience and friendly attention as they have given over the last few years.

We're very respectful and will take the greatest care and appreciation of your property, and love people who do the same with ours!

We love traveling, cooking, and daily exercise. We are big dog lovers and are enjoying our new cavoodle, Ruby.
1820335.name: Sherry

2052335.self_intro: I am a semi retired man who is happily running a small family accommodation business for you to enjoy!
2052335.name: Keith

688781.self_intro:
I'm am an artist, Silverfox model, Airbnb host, mother of four wonderful adult kids, proud grandmother of a baby girl born in the UK in November 2018, besotted dog owner and live in the top two level of a beautiful, light-filled three-level renovated church building.

Sharing my home (the street level) with Airbnb guests is one of the best things I've ever done. It's given me connections with many amazing people. I've found that the kind of people who choose Airbnb are adventurous, friendly, warm, intelligent, curious and often have fascinating stories to tell about their own lives.

When I travel, I stay at Airbnb places and each place I've chosen has been unique, full of character and has offered so much more than a stark and sterile hotel room. Meeting my hosts has been another benefit - they are all wonderful people.

I have a dog – a Lagotto Romagnola – whose name is Mucca and she shares my space upstairs. She's very friendly and lovable and is classified as 'hypoallergenic' so should not be a problem for guests with allergies.
688781.name: Lynn

29889587.self_intro: I am nice dude with some nice dreams :D
29889587.name: Shukhratjon

6779186.self_intro:
Life is great.  I have 2 beautiful children, an amazing husband and a great career in a wood workshop.  We are keen sailors, campers and generally outdoorsy people.  

As a host, I try to give our guests maximum privacy while still being available to answer questions or deal with issues should they arise.  As a guest, I'm very respectful of the places we stay and know what goes into a changeover so try to help out where I can.

I grew up in Sydney and have finally returned after many years living in various parts of the world - France, USA, UK, Singapore.  Airbnb has enabled us to keep the travel bug alive within us.
6779186.name: Heather

131859707.self_intro:
I am a 35 year old male who works as a corporate professional. I live alone in my two bedroom apartment and spend very little time at home due to my demanding career. 

When I am home, I enjoy a very quiet lifestyle. A home cooked meal and an early night is how I spend my time at home. I work six days a week with early starts and late finishes, I am very rarely home. 

I take pride in my modest home by keeping it clean and tidy. I don’t host parties or rowdy groups.
131859707.name: Braith

1943399.self_intro:
I (Paul) am a psychotherapist and Senior Lecturer at the largest counselling and psychotherapy college in Australia. This work is fascinating both in terms of the wonderful clients, students, and staff with whom I work.  I spent 10 years conducting social research on sexual behaviour, gender and sexuality, having come to academia late after running a manufacturing business, driving trams in Melbourne (a job a STILL have great dreams about!) and a wasted year in a clothing factory after high school. 

Raymond works as an analyst in government and corporate media, a field he has been involved in since graduation. After his honours year, he spent the best part of the next year backpacking around the world. Every continent covered.... except Antarctica. So that's on our mutual Wishlist!

Meeting guests - especially those visiting Australia - is like having a little holiday without leaving Sydney as we get to hear what their home countries are like. We manage to meet over 80% of our guests to welcome them to town! And this is the best part of being hosts with Airbnb. We have also been really lucky to meet a lot of other local hosts, managers from the San Francisco head office, and the wonderful, warm and friendly staff at the Sydney office. Paul was also asked to speak on the SuperHost panel at the inaugural Airbnb Open in November of 2014 and we both attended the Paris Open in 2015. It was really thrilling to be included with such passionate, professional hosts talking to a huge room full of excited people. 

We have traveled extensively including staying in hotels, hotels, on the beach, and latterly in Airbnb homes. So we really know what makes for a good stay. It's both a pleasure and an honour to have folks stay at here, especially international guests who are traveling around this lovely country.

We have three great apartments, close to the centre of Sydney, available as the entire place for up to four guests. We do not stay when guests are staying - you have the whole apartment to yourselves.

Redfern is an original area of Sydney, featuring some of the oldest homes dating back to the 18th and 19th centuries. Prince Alfred Park is nearby, and the city itself is on the other side of that. You can literally walk to town in under 10 minutes, and it is well supported with public transport to all parts of the city only a four blocks from the front door.
1943399.name: Paul And Raymond

8963402.self_intro:
We chose Sydney as our home over 18 years ago and have loved digging under it's glittering beach destination facade to discover the hidden gems.
We run a creative agency and have a 7 year old kid and an old dog.

If you are living here it means that I am actually travelling or living at my girlfriend's house.

detail: Lives in New South Wales, Australia
45620575.self_intro:
We are a gay couple and have been living in Newtown for some time, and love this part of Sydney. Newtown is a unique suburb, full with people who are down to earth and kind. We're lucky enough to have some of the best bars and restaurants in Sydney, as well as excellent access to the city.

We've an Italian Greyhound, who tines and smells great, is fully house trained and is always on his best behaviour. He loves hanging out with people if they are home and tends to do his own thing.

We love our place in Newtown and we hope you will too. We rent out our spare bedroom through bnb when our friends and family aren't visiting. As much as we love our space, we also love meeting people from around the globe and sharing stories and experiences from our travels.

And we love going out for a nice meal or drinks. We love trying new restaurants and small bars that seem to pop up all the time in Newtown. We love cooking for our friends and family, and happy to share a meal or two with our guests. We love good wine and food, movies, music and outdoor activities such as the beach.

As hosts, it's our duty to ensure you know about all the great things that Sydney has to offer, including the highlights of Newtown and the inner west.

We're hopping to meet you soon!

Tom Trevor and Thongfar
45620575.name: Trevor

In my spare time, I like to paint and walk my poodle, Lulu, at the nearby dog-friendly park. During my travels abroad I have enjoyed staying in Airbnb apartments and I would love to return the favour to intrepid travellers visiting my beautiful city.

8247293.self_intro: I grew up in Sydney's inner city and still think it's a pretty magical place. I've spent one year in South America, one year in California and backpacked bits of Europe and New Zealand. I studied for a long time in the liberal arts, mostly theatre/gender/performance. Some of my favourite things are white balsamic vinegar, ocean swims, wandering open-air markets and dancing to Tom Waits' more tuneful numbers with my little girl.
8247293.name: Ariana

7028222.self_intro:
Hi there
My name is Kylie which, not many people know,  is actually an Australian aboriginal word for Boomerang. 
I bought this apartment decades ago because I loved the area and wanted to close to the city and my work. It’s such a melting pot of interesting culture and entertainment, but also a real community. 
For over a decade I worked at the Art Gallery of NSW which is a short walk from the apartment. I’d walk into work every day and most days do a quick walk at lunch time around the Botanical Gardens to take in the view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. 
I moved out when we had our baby and wanted to be closer to family. We love doing Airbnb as we love hosting and it keeps us connected to the area.
7028222.name: Kylie

19949885.self_intro: I am a wife and mother of two boys and own a lifestyle communications agency but at my core I am a lover of the hospitality industry. I love nothing more than hosting people and telling them about my homes, whether it is the inner city suburb of Paddington Sydney, or the countryside of Evandale Tasmania. I know how to have fun and eat and drink well so will have lots of recommendations to share with you! My favourite destination outside of Sydney and Evandale, Tasmania is anywhere in Italy.
19949885.name: Genevieve

410489.self_intro:
Hi, I discovered Airb&b when planning a trip last year. We had a great time and stayed in 8 listings in 2 continents. I took my time choosing places and it paid off. All the 8 listings were very good and a few were outstanding for different reasons. All the hosts were genuine, caring and interesting people.We took care of their places and have been invited back to all of them. What more can I say? As a guest traveling the world I know I was looking for a good sleep on a comfortable bed and a pleasant outlook that felt safe so I could enjoy being a tourist .The fact that we also met lovely interesting people and that I didn't break the bank with Hotel prices, well that was good too.I can confidently offer you this with my studio listing and its location is perfect for accessing the city, universities and beaches.
I love nature and enjoy nurturing my garden and other creative activities. I can point you in the direction of art galleries and good live music.
410489.name: Michal

17061.self_intro:
G'Day from Australia!

He's Vinh, and I'm Stuart...

We're big fans of AirBnB for nearly a decade having used it when traveling in the USA not long after AirBnB first started.

Since then we've enjoyed traveling with AirBnB across the US, around Australia, in Hong Kong, and also in Vietnam. We're also hosts.

As guests we're always out & about most of the time and won't be intruding too much.

We're neat & tidy and vibrant conversationalists...

We operate ArtSHINE industries - Australia’s independent Creative Industries Enterprise Acceleration Platform + Launch Pad identifying, advancing, and funding commercially minded and innovative Creative Industries Professionals who focus on art, craft, artisanal making, design, fashion, entertainment, photography, music, writing, film & television, digital technology, and games & interactive content. ArtSHINE also incorporates a coffeehouse and coworking space; CoSydney CoWorking + Project Space, in the City of Sydney’s Chippendale Creative Precinct.

So here's an open invitation to come check us out.

My partner Vinh is a keen traveler who works a lot with artists and designers in his coaching practice. He's the energetic, vibrant one...

I lived in Bolivia for a year as a young man just out of school and have worked in social enterprises and not for profits over the years. I'm the more serious, bookish one (with a wicked sense of humour though). Currently working in financial services too...

One of the things we're keen to do is catch up with some social entrepreneurs, coworkers, not for profits, and microfinanciers.

We're particularly interested social enterprise, coworking, and small business incubators & mentoring projects.

More that happy to answer any questions that you may have.

All the best,

Vinh & Stuart
Australia
17061.name: Stuart

Hi guys!

My name is David. Thank you for clicking this page to know more about me. 

If you are planning to come to Sydney or Melbourne, Australia or Phuket, Thailand. WELCOME! and I am sure you will enjoy your journey. 

I am from property consulting background and I am just like you and the others here who like to travel and find a comfortable place to stay at a convenient location. When I go overseas and interstates, I spend hours and hours to search for accommodation. that's why I understand you and would love to help if I could make your stay a bit easier and more relaxed.

Feel free to send me a message. I look forward to hearing from you.

If you are home owners or hosts. I also provide cleaning, management and consultation service. Please do not hesitate to contact me.

Hello! 大家好!
我是David,謝謝你按進這一版來看我的自我介紹｡
我是澳籍華人,從香港多年前移民來到澳洲｡在悉尼居住了幾年｡

我和你一樣,喜歡旅遊或者偶而出去走走｡每次找住的地方,都希望住得舒適,而且地點又方便｡所以我很了解你的心情,也希望可以幫到你一點的忙,讓你的住宿的體驗可以輕鬆和簡單一點｡

歡迎你隨時用中文和我溝通｡

同時,我也幫業主做管理和資詢,歡迎聯絡我｡

I am interested in Eastern religions and culture, but have also spent time in USA and Canada in the 70's hitching from LA to Vancouver and across to Montreal, so I have a lot of great traveling stories.
These days I don't hitch but I love meeting fellow travellers and exploring new places. One of my favorite destinations in Luang Prabang in Laos, I lead a writers retreat there every November.
My life motto is passed down from my mother to me  - Happiness through creativity.

I'm Carlos. My wife and I love to travel. We've been to so many places around the world, and we found out that the most important thing is feeling at home even traveling. That's why we decided giving you the opportunity to enjoy a fresh and minimalist place where you will feel nice and comfortable. 

Our favourite thing about our home is the location. Being so close to shops, restaurants, bus stops, wharf or train stations is a privilege that we are blessed with, as we are able to say that we are close to everywhere. 

We just would ask you one thing: enjoy and treat our lovely home as you would like us to enjoy and treat yours.

50183566.self_intro:
Hi,

I love the older style of my home. The house is a rental that i have been living in for 8 years now. It's in a nice area, but we are pretty much the only unrenovated house. My flatmate, Morten, has been a close friend for 20 years and we enjoy living together again after 15 years.

I am into sustainability and cutting down consumer waste so much of my furniture is rescued. 

At home I love my garden. I always have something on the go. This summer is tomatoes, eggplant, capsicums, zucchini and kale. There is some parsley, basil, sage, thyme and chives - feel free to help yourself and add some to your meal. I have slowly been trying different methods of garden beds to see what works - this year i have made mini Hugglekulture beds. They seem to be cracking along.

We are pretty relaxed and quiet around the house. No loud music - respectful of eveyones sound space. We love to have a chat. Sometimes i play the guitar or ukulele in the garden.

Out and about i love the beach, cycling, getting out to live music and shows and interesting community events.

I work in disability care close to home. I have travelled in South East Asia, India, US and Mexico and lived in Japan for 2 years teaching English.
50183566.name: Petra

15885982.self_intro:
Hello, and thank you very much for having a look at our profile :) 

We (Julian Wong & André Cardoso) are a married couple of dreamers. We're also hosts, travellers, performers and teachers. Along with a wonderful little team, our aim is to create spaces for people to find some peace, have a little fun, touch the ground, and hopefully learn a thing or two. 

We live, host and teach in three locations in the Sydney region. In the heart of the city are our Fig Tree House in Woolloomooloo, and Sycamore Place in Surry Hills. In the gorgeous Blue Mountains is our Secret Valley Escape, about 2 hours away. We're constantly bouncing between the city and mountains, and it makes us very happy to share them with people from all over the world. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Julian, a native Sydney-sider, travels extensively and works as a performance artist in dance, music and physical theatre. He is also a practitioner of the Feldenkrais Method, which is a movement based learning process. His family is from Wenzhou, China, and he is a total sucker for food. 

André is a Portuguese-American who went to uni in Sweden, and was brought to Australia by love. He likes long walks in the wilderness, teaches yoga and meditation, plays jazz, and can often be found in a turquoise alpaca sweater. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

As well as hosting, we aim to have regular gatherings where we can share our practices, learn with others, tell stories, and play music together. If you are interested, please let us know! 

Thank you again, and welcome.
15885982.name: Julian & André

6764823.self_intro:
I am a mid-late 30's gay male with spare room available at my flat.  I'm not an outrageous queen but don't mind if you are (or one of you or anyone else is!).  Straight, gay, asexual (lol), couples, friends, individuals all welcome.  

I work in people facing IT roles, where I talk to people about what they want to achieve and then translate that to the 'real' IT people who make it happen.  I really enjoy connecting peoples needs with solutions.  The best part of what I do is getting to form relationships with people and that really cool sense of satisfaction when you know you've made a positive impact for someone.  Anyway, enough geek speak!

On week days I generally get up 6ish for gym and work and/or head to the gym after work, so if you are home during the day, you'll have the house to yourself.  Weekends I may be out with friends, dinner, pubs, clubs (or recovering from these) depending what's on, but sometimes I like to chill at home.  I volunteer with a charity to feed homeless people on Saturday evenings.  It's surprisingly fun if you would like to check it out.  You're also welcome to join in socialising if you are at a loose end or have just moved here and want to make new friends.

Sometimes I do a bit of travel myself and may be away.  That's a bummer because I may not get to meet you, but on the plus side you will have the house to yourself.  I do have a fantastic co-host when I am away.  His name is Fred and he's great.  If you need to message for advice or help, he/his team or I will be ready to advise you and we are happy to do so.

My friends and I are super nice, friendly people so if you want some tips about Sydney, where to go, what to see etc, we're sweet to help you out.  At home, I'm totally happy to break out 5 minutes of small talk and leave you in peace if that's what you prefer.  

I've been on AirBnB since 2013 and have hosted more than 200 guests now.  Originaly, I decided to host instead of having house mates.  It's not a 'for profit' thing for me, just another way of splitting house costs.  

I've met so many awesome people through AirBnB, some of whom now live in Sydney and are close friends.  You may get to meet some of them :)
  
If you come stay, I hope you will feel as at home here as you would at your own place.  You're basically a house mate while you're here.  I would just ask you treat the place like you would your own, have respect for the neighbours in the building and take care of the owners investment in this beautiful property that we are so fortunate to stay in.  Nothing too stressful.  :)
6764823.name: Reid

156590983.self_intro:
Hi I’m Diana. I’m a fun, energetic mum of twin girls. A perfect day for me is waking up, doing a quick session at the gym, then heading off to a local cafe with my husband and girls. If the weather is nice, I love to go for a walk with my family. Or even take a stroll by the beach on my own. On the weekends we also like to do quick day trips to Port Stephens (about a 40 min drive away). If it’s more on the cold or rainy side, I also don’t mind hitting up the shops. Then later going out to dinner, and finishing the night with a good Netflix session. 
 
My husband’s loves Newcastle in the winter. His favourite things to do are catching the local soccer and rugby games, trying new cafes and restaurants, and taking a romantic day trip to the Hunter Valley (approx 45 mins drive) or even catching a live show there. Can't forget to mention he loves to go fishing on Newcastle harbour.
 
I’ve lived in Newcastle all my life, so I not only love the lifestyle, but I have plenty of local knowledge. I’ve seen it grow from a very industrial place into a buzzing city with a whole new vibe. Newcastle now boasts a flourishing cafe and bar culture offering everything from artisan gelato to craft beers. There are trendy new bars popping up in ex-laundromats (The Edwards), a surf club that would give Icebergs in Bondi a good run for its money (Merewether Surfhouse), and even a bar in a mutil-million dollar renovated car workshop (Parry St Garage). But if you were to ask me for my top 5 ‘Newy' must - sees they would have to be: 
1. A walk along The Anzac Memorial Walk
2. A visit to the old retro Tower Cinemas - which have pretty much not changed since the 80’s
3. Walking along the Breakwall and seeing the big ships come in
4. Taking the kids to the rock pool at Bar Beach
5. Heading to King Edward’s Park and watching the kids run up and down the hill with also some of Newcastle best views. 
 
If there’s else anything you need to know, or would like any more of my personal recommendations on cafes, restaurants, parks, shops, or things to do, I’d be happy to help.
156590983.name: Diana

I am Gerald, or Gerry if you want, Born in NYC, Washington Heights, went to High School of Music & Art (The Castle) then Pratt Institute in Brooklyn. Worked as Lifeguard at Rockaway Beach in the summers (got addicted to the Sea). Lived in Montreal for eight years; met a girl in a bar & moved to Australia  42 years ago. Worked for the major Ad agencies in North Sydney then started my own. Got out after 18 years (enough was enough) after building up to a 70 million dollar business. Lived in the Eastern Suburbs of Sydney in Bronte until enough was enough there too. 
Finally moved down here to the Illawarra 17 years ago so i could follow my passion of uncrowded surfing. Yep, am retired now and loving it. Unfortunately my wife, who was a painter, of 30 years passed away 2 years ago so I have redone her studio (which i had built for her) into this - I think- really nice bnb.
Surfed & discovered Puerto Rico surf spots decades ago & have been to the Maldives surfing 5 times; Java, Indonesia 3 and surf the beaches around here when I want. 
Love music; The Blues, Reggie, Late 60&70s R&R: Led Zep, Dylan, Jimi, Cream, The Oils, etc. Classical; Ravel, Debussy, Korsakov,etc.
Vikings is still the best show on TV in years.
It's all very laid back here. I'm one of those slow/fast people.  
I have a daughter , who lives on the east/west coasts of the US, who i am in contact with frequently.
Motto: Mutual respect and responsibility.
My View: You are a paying client & will be treated as such - like in the ad biz.

Most of our adult children and their children live on the Central Coast. It’s a wonderful part of the world; surrounded by water, and teeming with cafés, restaurants and beautiful scenery.

Just over an hour from Sydney, Daleys Retreat is ideal for small groups and families to unwind. Upper and lower levels provide personal space. The large living area and entertainment deck bring everybody together for fun times. We love it when we manage to get there, and we know you will too.

We have toured around the country and extensively in our region. Please feel welcome to ask us about where to visit in our area. We enjoy bike riding ourselves and can give you many ideas on short or long rides around town or the hills. We can even lend you some bikes!

We look forward to outdoor pursuits with one daughter who takes us bushwalking and rockclimbing. Watching our other daughter play in the AFLW is another highlight. Our boys have seemed to worked out the best places to dine out and always treat us when we are in Melbourne! Here in Albury, we always look forward to visiting MAMA and Noreuil Park - our local treasures!

Yes, we do work full time but look forward to a chat with you when we are home!

My name is Benny your host, pleased to meet you! I intend to help with your stay to be a relaxing & enjoyable one.
"The Ivy Lodge" is a Heritage listed 152 year old Cottage that has had only 3 owners, I am the 4th owner to have lovingly restored the building with good attention to detail. I operate short stays, so therefore I enjoy reinvesting back into the the cottage by creating new & fresh ideas with furnishings, linen & landscaping, and I promise to focus on meeting guest needs and requests so please feel free to give me feedback where I can improve.

I have dedicated 6 years of my life in beautiful Bathurst to be with my son while he schools here, and I am a professional photographer, you will see some of my works on the walls that tell a story of the region and all its beauty.  

I am usually found residing behind the cottage in very close proximity if needed by guests. I have designed the interior and furnishings of somewhere I might want to stay, so I hope that it makes you feel at home. I really hope to share this Cottage "The Ivy Lodge" with others for many years to come, and thank you for taking the time to visit. 

Benny

I spend my leisure time training in acrobatics, going to theatre, galleries and performances, and cooking dinner with friends.

1179090.self_intro:
Hi - I live on the waterfront of Lake Macquarie in NSW near Newcastle in Australia.   Lake Macquarie is the largest saltwater lake in the southern hemisphere.  My home in Martinsville is only 15 minutes from the Lake and about an hour and 50 mins north of Sydney centre, easy access off the freeway.    The location is a perfect springboard to the real Australia not just the capital cities.  Half an hour to the renown Hunter Valley where you can enjoy Australian wine country, wine tastings, art galleries, cheese and chocolate factory.    Also half an hour to the historical town of Morpeth.   Of course there is Newcastle the largest city in Australia that is not a capital - enjoy the foreshore and beaches.  Stockton Beach and Port Stephens are a great day trip.  

Who is  Vanessa?   I run a home styling business - Enviable Home Styling.  I style homes for sale and also have run a photography business for years.  I love travel and have house swapped several times. 

I enjoy good taste and quality, great food in a range of styles - I enjoy spicy food.  My favourite destinations have been France, Spain, Sri Lanka, Thailand but really want to experience so much - life is short and the world is huge.  I travel regularly.
1179090.name: Vanessa

217126345.self_intro: I love coffee, wine and sunshine

Anthea

84629238.self_intro:
Andrew and I are new to Airbnb and very much looking forward to the adventures to come. 
Our main priority is to meet new people from different walks of life; people that we might not otherwise have the chance to meet. 
We're a pair of empty nesters who have not let the grass grow under our feet since our children left home. 
We take the opportunity to travel as often as we can. We like to take off on our motorbikes and find tiny out of the way places where we can kick back  while we natter with the locals and make new friends. 
Our last trip was along the Great Dividing Range to the Snowies and then to Eden and back up the coast. 
Relaxing and exhilarating at the same time! 
This summer we plan to ride up to one of our favourite places, Cairns.
Chances are when you get to The Reservoir we wont be there to meet you. 
We hope that when you stay with us that you will go away feeling relaxed and rejuvenated. Our aim is to provide a tranquil space that you can use as a base to explore this lovely part of NSW.  Either that or kick off your shoes . . .  and breathe.

I'm a journalist/sub editor for a regional daily newspaper and keen to start traveling internationally now my daughter has grown up. I'm a 'young' 48, looking forward to venturing out of Australia more and soaking up different cultures and sights and perhaps write a few travel stories along the way. My partner Simon is a photographer and wine writer who has some travel experience and is keen to get more.
We opened our own boutique, short-stay accommodation The Grey House in our hometown of Grafton in July 2014. It's 130 year old worker's cottage we have restored to create a homely but stylish space for visitors to rest their head and explore our historic city with its vast waterway -- the Clarence River -- right at its centre.
In 2017 we added Troutbeck Cottage, Ebor (1.5 hours from Grafton) to our Airbnb family. The cute one-bedroom mountain escape is in walking distance to village's famous waterfalls. It has been refurbished to channelling a Scandi  cabin style and is suitable for couples and families wanting to get back to nature in comfort.
I'm an avid collector of vintage furniture and contemporary art some of which you will see at both The Grey House and Troutbeck Cottage.

29718706.self_intro:
About Eva

Eva (born in the Czech Republic) and husband Andre originally stayed at SkyView Villa as paying guests many times over, thoroughly loving the view, comfort and holiday feel offered by SkyView Villa. And when the opportunity presented itself to buy SkyView Villa they did not hesitate. Now with two teenage children plus being based in Sydney, the opportunities to go down to SkyView Villa are not as numerous as they were when the two children were younger. So they have decided to share SkyView Villa with others in the hope that you also gain the immense enjoyment that staying at SkyView Villa has brought them.

Eva purchased SkyView Villa in 2000.

Why did Eva choose Kangaroo Valley?

SkyView's stunning views set the backdrop for a relaxing holiday where it is all too easy to unwind. The comfortable and well appointed villa will keep you at just the right temperature with 4 air-conditioner units throughout the cabin. A Weber BBQ plus a full kitchen ensures that life's culinary pursuits can be well catered for if you should so choose.

Austar plus a small library of movies via a 50 inch LCD TV set in the lounge provides quality entertainment for the whole family. A 42 inch TV set in the downstairs queen bedroom provides either private viewing in bed or a place for the kids to be entertained while mum and dad have peace and quite in the lounge. Two DVD players allow hired DVD's from Kangaroo Valley Village to be viewed. Enjoyment of your favourite music has not been forgotten with a Bluetooth speaker that will allow you to enjoy your favourite music that is on your own smart device.

SkyView Villa is positioned right on the golf course but is located in such a manner so as to be completely safe from any stray golf balls. Apart from the golf course the resort offers you bush walks, two tennis courts, a swimming pool, a volley ball court (with beach sand) and giant chess for you to enjoy.

What makes SkyView Villa unique?

The combination of fresh air, comfort, wonderful views and tranquillity in the country side makes SkyView Villa a perfect destination to unwind and relax in. If one is inclined to explore then there is an amazing variety of options to choose from.
29718706.name: Eva

I do Pilates, walk and go to the gym often, am nearly always on a diet (5/2 is our preference!!) because of my love of cooking, eating and a couple of red wines. we hope to see you at EagleViewPark soon
Helen & Bernard

We  spend  many nights just sitting up at the beach watching the sunset.
Some things in life that Doug and I would not be without are our children and grandchildren. We enjoy going to the movies and catching up with friends. 

Where we live we tend not to get into a car if possible . It is so close to everything and within walking distance to everywhere.

Our motto would have to be 'Say it how it is '.
We only get one chance at life so don't worry about what anyone else thinks just Live Your Own Life.

We still have Fergus, who, unlike Bonnie is a not so friendly cat who prefers to hide rather than be social.
I'm proud of the way Newcastle has shifted the old industrial image and replaced it with one of beauty and convenience, a great place to bring up my three (now adult) children. I have three gorgeous grandchildren who visit now and then. I enjoy meeting up with friends for coffee or a meal. I like a good coffee. I am often away so you will have the privacy of the house at those times or a room using all the house facilities and sharing with me. When I'm away I have family and friends who will look after you if there is any problem
 I love living in Newcastle and look forward to sharing ideas on where to go, what to see and great restaurants etc.
 I grow my own greens, eat organic if possible and live fairly quietly. Loud music doesn't appeal much but TV and DVD is available.

Favourite pastimes are teaching my teenaged grandchildren to drive and spending regular time with my four  little ones - 6, 4, 4, and 2.  They're so precious.

I am currently still working from my home here in Hamilton. Hence, the sign on the front wall! However, I am scaling back my work these days to allow more time for my gorgeous grandkids and also to do a little bit of painting. I like to dabble and you'll see some of my efforts on the walls!

I have lived in this house since 1980, and loved it into shape over all these years. One of the things I love most about living here is that it is so convenient to shops, cafes, restaurants, lovely walks to our local parks, along Throsby Creek, beside the harbour or up to the beaches. Newcastle is a beautiful place!

I enjoy my garden, socialising with family and friends, getting outdoors, art, films and music. I also love to travel and so far have managed to see some of Europe, UK, India, USA and South America. Still keen to do more! There's a lot more world to see.

I'm looking forward to meeting people through AirBnB, sharing some stories - all part of life's rich tapestry!

detail: Work: Board Certified Drugless Practioner, Yoga Therapist, Teacher, Personal Trainer, Quantum Health Coach & PhD & Doctorate Candidate-Integral Medicine
118141676.self_intro:
Brian and I have enjoyed living in the beautiful Hawkesbury River area for 27 years. Originally we moved to the 'boat access only' Dangar Island- about 4 minutes from the fishing village of Brooklyn. For some 15 years we have been keenly interested in renovating our 1860's sandstone building, "Riversands"-built out of the the surrounding sandstone features. We enjoy kayaking, fishing, swimming, bush walking, dining in the local area. Brooklyn is surrounded by National Parks and the river and is listed as Environmentally Sensitive.
Although the village lies in a natural bushland setting it is only 1 hour by train from Sydney CBD. Brian commutes to work daily. The train provides easy access to Sydney social events such as those held at the Opera House. The village offers cafes and restaurants well as hire recreational activities. A police survey report rates Brooklyn to be one of the safest communities in Sydney.
Anyone interested in a Personalised Yoga Class or relax with a Guided Meditation, enquire with me. POA.

My motto is:
Our goal should be to live life in radical amazement...get up in the morning and look at the world in a way that takes nothing for granted.  Everything is phenomenal; everything is incredible; never treat life casually.  To be spiritual is to be amazed..." Abraham Joshua  Heschel.
118141676.name: Joanne

33953004.self_intro:
I am a creative and passionate person who loves to design and create interesting concepts in art and design. I started to paint at the age of three in my father’s studio. His rule of thumb was to always finish what you started even though you thought it was a piece of junk. What I learned from that was mistakes sometimes could become beautiful paintings. I also learned to be dedicated to my art, to keep painting until something moved me. I am not afraid to try new things because for me it is always a way of experimenting. I like challenges and finding ways to express my stories to the viewer. It helps me express my voice in my work, without writing or speaking. I have a hard time verbalizing what's in my mind, it comes to me and the creative process is my journey.

My interest are: Interests: Surfing, snowboarding, yoga, passion, art, my son Diego, my man Wayne, soccer, dancing, designing and playing.

We are both Sydney born and bred and apparently we are getting older but that is not always what we feel. We are both still running our own businesses so work hard during the week but in down time love sailing, theatre, live music and entertaining. We have a significant number of adult children (phew – all of whom have left home) and remain very engaged in all that offers to us (whether we “always” like it or not!!!! ) 
We love our primary home on the beach in a little village South of Sydney (about 1.5 hours’ drive – or rail)  and relish walking our dogs on the beach every day but also adore getting up to the big smoke and utilising all that offers to us and others. We love travelling and continue to explore places regularly that we have not yet seen together but always try and fit in New York which is our combined favourite city outside our own.
We particularly enjoy our new little apartment in Darlinghurst…and we hope you will too. We have attempted to set up a little “crash pad” filled with love which we feel very comfortable in - which we hope you also appreciate. We have done this in in a wonderful part of our city (which we find edgy but exciting) and so …. Enjoy and welcome to the “Darlings” – we feel confident you will enjoy your stay…that is certainly our intention.

102301031.self_intro:
...to be, do, have, and share...
I am a female entrepreneur who has co-established SAYER - Student Advocacy, Youth & Educational Research. SAYER has been established for children and the youth of Australia. It is a local organisation that will support families and other key players in their quest to provide greater opportunities for children and young people. SAYER’s agendas are inclusive and seek to find ways to support the communities of children, especially our most at-risk members. Primarily it is embedded within education, but is also capable of filtering into other contexts - social, health, environmental, cultural and spiritual. SAYER is fundamentally a portal for collaborative input, empowerment and change | sayer.global

Robert surfs or paddle boards every day, I love swimming (when it’s warm) and walking our dog around the beautiful headland and along the beach. We are blessed to live where we can hear the waves, smell the salt, watch the dolphins and sea birds and just relax in a quiet pocket of the South Coast.
We  love entertaining, but also enjoy dining out in nearby Shellharbour Village - plenty of great choices there. Some of our favourites are Relish for modern Aust cuisine, Andaman Thai, Suashan Indian, Green Poppy for morning or afternoon teas. Sometimes we eat out in Kiama or Wollongong or Berry, all of which offer a great variety of stunning cafes and restaurants.
We love travelling too - day trips to Sydney, new places in NSW, other Australian states and different overseas destinations. 
Airbnb is a great way to travel!

We live on the coast about an hour south of Sydney and have listed our Sydney apartment with Airbnb and, also a private apartment attached to our home in Wombarra. We both grew up in Sydney but have lived in the Illawarra for 30 years and consider Austinmer to be "God's country". The scenery is spectacular with a very relaxed lifestyle.
We love great food and wine and are keen, but not always good, golfers.
We have traveled extensively. We like going to less mainstream spots and have had fabulous adventures in Cuba, Bhutan and Lapland.
We have a modern studio apartment that we have for friends staying over after great dinners and would now like to open that to the airbnb community.
If we're home we will happily meet you and tell you all the local secrets and then leave you alone. We totally respect your privacy. If we are away, then all you need to know will be in the guide book in your apartment.
Our goal is for you to be happy!

If I'm around I can make myself available to help or guide visitors about the best places to see and things to do in the area and in Sydney (where I grew up). I keep to myself but would be happy to share some meals and stories of my travels. Maybe just go along to a Sunset Sessions at one of the local Surf Clubs with drinks on the balcony or take a walk along the lake edge. There's always something happening in the park and the lake fishing is pretty good I hear! The idea is you get to do as much or as little as you want. Enjoy.
As a guest, I respect your privacy and your property and always leave everything the way I found it. I would love to interact to find out about the local areas and cultures to make the experience even better (especially when overseas).

The kids have grown up and moved out, so we renovated their sleep-out/rumpus into a self contained studio flat and really enjoy sharing it with family & friends and other folk looking for a peaceful short stay on the Central Coast.  I've used Air BnB for many of my holidays in Australia and business stays  - it's a great way to travel!  So I'm really enjoying being a host now and giving that opportunity to others. It's so nice to meet different people and hear a little of their stories.

Our cottage was our first home with my husband and I renovating it extensively to what it is today. detail: Work: The Yellow Door Guesthouse & KeyStone Est. 1889
49383189.self_intro:
The Yellow Door & Co. are an expanding group of people who have come together to deliver ‘top shelf’ stays for guests visiting Bathurst. 

We all love what our local region has to offer, and celebrate the fact we are the oldest inland settlement in Australia! Particularly the historic buildings from the Victorian, Edwardian, and Art Deco eras which line our streets. 

We are a really easy going crew of family & friends who all enjoy socialising with good eats, good drinks & laughs with great company. 

Our core values mean we host real and honest  stays for our guests. We achieve this through using our 'consistency is key' approach, and always having a fine attention to the details which makes guest stays extra special. 

The property owners  affiliated with TYD & Co. all enjoy  reinvesting back into their properties by creating new & fresh ideas with their furnishings/linen/landscaping, and styling. Particularly when guests identify needs for their stay, we aim to meet these requests promptly. 

Our group members have all dedicated many  years of service to the Community/Welfare Sector, so we feel very fortunate to have the opportunity of hosting guests within our local Tourism & Hospitality space. And some of us also have extensive  experience within the Building & Construction Industry - this certainly helps for all our hosted properties to retain a high standard of property management. 

We really hope you’ve got a chance to experience all that TYD & Co. have to offer, as we want to share these homes with guests visiting Bathurst for many years to come...
49383189.name: T.Y.D

42236856.self_intro:
Our journey begain in 2007 when we commenced our complete and sympathetic restoration on both the outside and inside which was really the major transformation as it was in an alarming state of disrepair and neglect!
The entire stone structure required engineered support and rectification. It would seem that the building and grounds had received little Love at all since being decommissioned as a Baptist Church in the early 1970's. 
Our united efforts in the design elements and long years in Europe helped define the details required to achieve the truly unique and luxurious ambience now to be enjoyed by our guests and ourselves of course when we sneak in for our fix of luxurious peace and tranquility. 
Significantly we were able to complete the works and start a new era for the building as Outback Church Stay coinciding with the 100 year birthday of the original build date captured in the marble foundation blockwork built into the front facade. Truly a very satisfying feeling to have actually saved and re-purposed an iconic structure for future generations.

 

We hope you have a really great holiday and enjoy your stay in your choice of our homes away from home.
42236856.name: Andrea And Guy

Helen is our Assitant to the Manager and she has exceptional customer service skills. We are very lucky to have her running our business. You will see me from time to time as I still like to spend a couple of days a week relieving.
Trying to be semi retired we find time to support charities. Terry's passion is the Royal Flying Doctor Service and has been the local President for 15 years and a Director for 11 years. Sue has given the Guide Dogs over 15 years service. 
Dubbo is a great place to visit and we love sharing this magical city with our guests.
Great News - Trip Advisor announced the 2018 Top 25 properties in Australia Awards on 26th January. Country Apartments has moved up to number 9 in Australia for Families and has been ranked number 14 in Australia for Customer Service. South Bowie', as the locals call it, is your special getaway, so come on out and explore the rolling hills, lakes, fishing spots, the local ZIGZAG brewery, springs and award winning local restaurants.

"Humans weren't designed to be locked to a Workstation, come outside and explore this beautiful Earth"

115853537.self_intro:
We look forward to being your hosts!
Our family moved to the Hunter Valley to escape the hustle and bustle of the city and settled in to a relaxing lifestyle. We can't live without good food - we bake bread, raise chickens, grow veggies and herbs, brew beer, avoid preservatives and cook clean, good food. We like nothing better than cooking fresh, regional produce and pairing it with good quality wines. As passionate foodies, we can assist with recommendations to the best eateries and bars in the region.
We have been travelling for decades, learning and exploring many cultures and cuisines around the world and here in Australia.. We understand travellers and their different needs, which is why we enjoy hosting on Airbnb.
We personally manage our three homes to maintain a level of high standard.
History buffs too and a lover of heritage architecture, spending years appreciating and restoring historic properties to their former glory. Denver ( c.1885) is our current project.
115853537.name: Allie

23166270.self_intro:
Originally from the North West Coast of Tasmania, from 6 generations of farming families that emigrated from Tipperary, Ireland. I am now residing in the Hunter Valley, NSW, with my now partner in crime, Darren, and his three gorgeous daughters.  

Ella, lives with us permanently, and is also our resident driver for our Airbnb guests. Laura and Isla visit us every other week. 

Darren is originally from Tassie too, and that’s a whole other yarn!

Darren and I love new challenges and experiences together.

We have enjoyed setting up our own Airbnb named “The Villa at Windella” at our property we have aptly called “Chateau Firmont”, which we purchased together in 2017. 

Firmont comes from firstly, that we could not see the home for the trees when we first took over the property, and secondly, Fairymount, near Terryglass in Tipperary, Ireland, where my father’s family emigrated from.

I have fell in love with the Hunter Valley and everything it has given back to me here, it is a magical place. There is so much to explore, see and do, so close to everything you could need.

We love promoting our discoveries with what this region has to offer to our guests. We enjoy life, meeting wonderful new people and discovering new places together.

We look forward to hosting or meeting you too, along the way!
23166270.name: Janelle

5839614.self_intro:
OUR STORY
A happy guest starts with a good night’s rest! That was the motivation behind the family owned business Canberra Short Term & Holiday Accommodation.  Known as “Canbhol” by the locals, it has been providing boutique self-catering, self-contained fully furnished accommodation for The Budget Conscious, The Tradies, The Holiday Makers, The Corporate and Diplomats as well as The Relocators and Renovators for over 15 years. A great range of self-catering & self-contained budget units and only minutes away from the centre of Canberra and abundant tourist attractions its why many have continued to choose Canberra Short Term and Holiday Accommodation.

OUR ACCOMMODATION OFFERINGS:
~ Free Wi-Fi 
~ Complimentary tea and coffee
~ 24 hour self-check service
~ Complimentary shopping service (enquire for further info)
~ Complimentary parking
~ No Commission Applied
~ BBQ facilities 

CANBHOL IS GETTING A MAKEOVER.

We are replacing & updating our balconies to building C which includes all our studio style units and Large 2 bedroom (2).

This building upgrade will ensure greater comfort for our valued guests.

The  makeover begins early October. During this time, most of our  balconies and courtyards will be unavailable however BBQs will be provided within the swimming pool area so guests can enjoy the wonderful weather and outdoor activities.

If you do require a balcony or courtyard throughout your stay please check first if numbers are available at this time.

We will do our best to provide you with your preference though we cannot guarantee this request can be provided.
5839614.name: Canberra Short Term

We built THE TREEHOUSE KANGAROO VALLEY  in conjunction with Mamaforma who through their innovative ideas and their respect for the natural environment came up with a unique treehouse design suspended over the banks of Kangaroo River and helping us to save all our beautiful trees.
We had our beautiful garden wedding at THE TREEHOUSE so it holds  a very special place in our hearts.
THE BEACH HOUSE GERRINGONG - was a recent renovation filled with love & soul & has crystallised into a beautiful Boho Beach Surf House with an island jungalow feel.
Our latest project has been a full renovation of an original beach cottage in Huskisson Jervis Bay called LUNA JERVIS BAY which is now available for bookings on Airbnb.
We love yoga, surfing and travelling. 
Our favourite travel destinations for holidays are India, Fiji,Thailand,Bali and North Queensland-anywhere its warm.

27511457.self_intro:
My husband and I are a strong team, committed to the same values in life and business. When we first decided to open the doors to our apartments as accommodation we both discovered we wanted it to be more than just an income. We wanted to create an experience for our guests that was easy, comfortable and memorable with these 5 principles:

1. Extra clean - Always well-maintained and clutter-free with only the most experienced cleaners/co-hosts on board
2. Comfortable and well-equipped - Ensuring high-quality bedding, fully furnished and amenities 
3. Charming and considered - Thoughtfully designed with our unique style and using only quality brands and gorgeous pieces
4. Committed - Never cancelling on our guests and ensuring they know we are there for them 24/7
5. Well-reviewed - Maintain a strong review rating from our guests

To date, we feel we've achieved this plus more. To read the amazing reviews from our guests, have guests rebook over again and know they have checked out with a smile on their face, keeps us powering forward and making these apartments an Airbnb to remember and refer.
27511457.name: Jackie
